H0.text: Some ancient animals and some modern animals walk on four legs is the conclusion that a scientist most likely reaches when comparing ancient animal tracks to modern animal tracks.

H1.text: Most ancient animals and most modern animals hunt animals for food is the conclusion the scientist is most likely to reach when comparing ancient animal tracks to modern animal tracks.

H2.text: The same animals that lived long ago also live today is the conclusion a scientist most likely reaches when comparing ancient animal tracks to modern animal tracks.

H3.text: All animals can walk is the conclusion that a scientist is most likely to reach when comparing ancient animal tracks to modern animal tracks.

A4.text: One animal can make many different kinds of traces, and one trace can be made by many different kinds of animals.
